revised_title: Variations in Decapod Crustacea: A Study on Crangon vulgaris
tldr: The author investigates the variations in size and shape of certain organs in the decapod crustacean Crangon vulgaris, collected from different locations. The study aims to determine the degree of accuracy with which local races of the species adjust to their environment and the frequency of deviations from the average size and shape of the organs. The results support the prediction that natural selection does not alter the law governing the frequency of deviations from the average size, suggesting that the law of error applies to all cases, regardless of the influence of natural selection.
